title: League Resolution Not Working
body:
I recently bought a new graphics card GTX 1050TI and installed it correctly a few times to make sure nothing went wrong but everytime i open league it seems to get forced into window 1024x768 even tho i have multiple times reset my resolution in the .cfg and ingame, when i change it ingame it seems to TRY to set it to that resolution but doesnt when i set it to borderless windowed it doesnt work either same with fullscreen and windowed im not sure what is going on as ive done everything including re-installing league i was on a 750TI before and it was working fine
Help if possible please

replies.body:
Greetings Puretwo,

This sounds like an weird issue that could be either hardware or software related, so I have a few things listed here that you could give a try to help fix the issue that you seem to be having:

**1) Have you updated your graphics cards drivers from Nvidia's Website?**

This is something that I often forget to do myself and you need to make sure that you do every time that you upgrade your graphics card. If you want a link to the website to make it easy for you to grab, [you can go here.](http://www.geforce.com/drivers) 

**2) Have you tried using a different monitor?**

I have noticed that the issue you were having is linked to a resolution issue. It might be worth trying using a different monitor just in case it might be the game trying to push itself to a resolution that the monitor is not able to display, thus reverting. It might be worth as well trying to slowly work your way up through the different resolutions.

**3) Consider trying a different connection or port for the monitor**

When you are connecting your monitor to your graphics card, have you tried using a different connection method or port? For example if you were using a HDMI connection, could you try a different port on the card, or maybe swapping over to a display port or DVI connection with a converter?

**4) When you were re installing league did you make sure to completely uninstall the game before re installing it?**

Sometimes when you re install league without first uninstalling it, it leaves a lot of the configuration files behind from the previous install a long with some other things. So if you haven't tried re installing through this method I would give this a try.

**5) Launch league with administrator privileges**

This is just a guess of something that might work to fix it, I am not sure if it it will, but it is worth a try.

--

If those don't work could you please send me through a full list of your system specifications? The easiest way to do that would be to do it through a [DirectX diagnostic.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq5) This will help me get a good idea as to what you are running inside of your PC to check for any parts that may clash with each other and cause issues such as the one you have mentioned.

Other than that you could try sending in a [support ticket.](http://support.riotgames.com)

--

Thank you for compiling the information and coming out to the Help and Support boards. I hope these ideas help you solve your issue and if there is anyway other ways I can lend a hand, let me know!

~Elam

Found out what the problem was, i was getting the problem on Diablo 3 aswell, turns out its a problem within the xbox app built into windows there is a setting called Game DVR and apparently it stops Direct X from being detected or something, So i have solved the issue
If anyone else has this problem make sure to let them know about this RITO <3
